data.title: Australian Police Uncover $6 Million in Cryptocurrency from Criminal Wallet
data.description: According to BlockBeats, Australian Federal Police Commissioner Krissy Barrett announced on Wednesday that a data scientist from the Criminal Asset Confiscation Taskforce successfully unlocked a cryptocurrency wallet containing over $6 million, believed to be held by a suspect. The breakthrough was achieved by identifying falsified numbers within the seed phrase sequence used to secure the wallet. The suspect had attempted to create a 'crypto trap' by adding numbers to the sequence, but the manual alterations were ultimately detected.

data.title: Bitcoin in MetaMask: Why you should put all your crypto eggs in one basket
data.description:
MetaMask spent years as the default gateway to Ethereum, the browser extension that turned “connect wallet” into muscle memory for millions of users. Now Consensys is betting that same reflex can work across blockchains.
source: https://cryptoslate.com/bitcoin-in-metamask-why-you-should-put-all-your-crypto-eggs-in-one-basket/

data.title: Ethereum fees hover near pennies as daily transactions top 1.6M
data.description:
Ethereum transaction fees remain at near all-time lows despite peak network activity that saw daily transactions top 1. 6 million for the first time since October’s market crash.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/ethereum-fees-pennies-daily-transactions-1-6m?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound

data.title: Ethereum's Gas Fees Remain Low Amid Rising Blockchain Activity
data.description:
According to Cointelegraph, Ethereum's blockchain activity is on the rise, yet gas fees on the network remain at historically low levels. This development suggests a more mature and scalable infrastructure capable of supporting advanced real-world applications. Currently, Ethereum transaction fees are at a mere 0.16 gwei, approximately $0.01 per transaction. For token swaps, the fees are slightly higher at $0.15, and for non-fungible token (NFT) sales, they stand at $0.27, as reported by blockchain data aggregator Milkroad. These low costs contrast sharply with previous periods of high network activity, where demand often drove fees to unsustainable levels, a major criticism of Ethereum in past cycles.

The network's daily transactions have surged to 1.6 million, marking a near one-month high, a level last observed at the beginning of October before a significant $19 billion liquidation event. Active addresses have also increased, reaching a monthly peak of 695,872, according to data from the crypto intelligence platform Nansen. The persistently low gas fees follow the implementation of the Dencun and Pectra upgrades, both aimed at reducing transaction costs and enhancing throughput. The Pectra upgrade, deployed in May, has notably doubled the blob capacity of layer-2 (L2) networks, effectively reducing transaction fees on L2s by approximately 50%. This upgrade has also facilitated the offloading of more transactions from the mainnet, further decreasing costs.

Ethereum's previous significant upgrade, Dencun, has also contributed to reducing L2 transaction fees and offloading more transactions from the L1. As a result, average Ethereum transaction fees have become 95% cheaper a year after its deployment on March 13, 2024, as reported by Cointelegraph. This series of upgrades underscores Ethereum's commitment to addressing past criticisms and enhancing its network's efficiency and scalability, paving the way for broader adoption and more complex use cases in the blockchain ecosystem.

data.title: BNB Surpasses 1,120 USDT with a 0.77% Increase in 24 Hours
data.description: On Oct 30, 2025, 10:22 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has crossed the 1,120 USDT benchmark and is now trading at 1,122.469971 USDT, with a narrowed 0.77% increase in 24 hours.

data.title: Stablecoin Introduction Could Pose Policy Challenges, Says Indian Central Bank Deputy Governor
data.description: According to Foresight News, the Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India has expressed concerns about the introduction of stablecoins, stating that it could lead to numerous policy issues that might otherwise be avoidable. The official highlighted the potential challenges that stablecoins could present to the existing financial system and regulatory framework.

data.title: Bank Indonesia Plans Launch of Stablecoin Backed by Government Bonds
data.description:

source: https://coincu.com/news/bank-indonesia-national-stablecoin/

data.title: Binance Announces Details of Momentum (MMT) Prime Sale Pre-TGE
data.description: Binance announced details of the Pre-TGE phase of its second Prime Sale project, Momentum (MMT), on October 30th. Each user can subscribe to a maximum of 7 BNB, and will receive an MMT Key (BSC) after the Pre-TGE phase ends. MMT tokens (Sui) will be airdropped to users' Alpha accounts on the TGE day.

data.description: OKX market data shows that BTC has fallen below 110,000 USDT, currently trading at 109,999.9 USDT, a 24-hour drop of 2.58%. (This news item was generated with AI assistance.)

data.title: ETH Treasury Company Seeks $1 Billion Through PIPE on CoinList Alpha
data.description: According to Foresight News, ETH Treasury Company, initiated by Avenir Group, Distributed Capital, Wanxiang Capital, and Meitu, is currently raising funds on CoinList Alpha. The company aims to secure $1 billion through private investment in public equity (PIPE) while issuing warrants at a 1:1 ratio with an exercise price 50% above the issuance price. The PIPE pricing is expected to be approximately 0.88 times the net asset value (mNAV). Investors on CoinList Alpha have until October 29 to make preliminary commitments, with payments due by October 31, 2025. Accepted payment methods include USD and USDC, with ETH payments possible if necessary.

data.title: Global Stock Markets Reach Record Highs Amid Bull Market Surge
data.description: According to BlockBeats, recent data from Kobeissi Letter reveals that approximately 60% of global stock markets have reached all-time highs over the past 21 days, marking the highest level in at least two years. Major markets, including those in the United States, Canada, Japan, the United Kingdom, and Germany, have all set new records. This percentage has doubled in recent weeks. The S&P 500 index alone has achieved 37 record highs this year, making it the third-best streak since 2017, following 57 highs in 2024 and 70 in 2021. The global bull market for risk assets is currently at its peak.

data.title: AEON launches the X402 coordinator on the BNB blockchain, advancing real-world autonomous AI payments.
data.description: AEON has launched the X402 Facilitator on the BNB blockchain, advancing real-world autonomous AI payments. (Reuters)

data.title: Two whales that followed a "100% win rate whale's" trades suffered a combined loss of over $1.2 million within the day.
data.description: According to crypto analyst Ai (@ai_9684xtpa), two whales who followed the "100% win rate whale" strategy during the volatile market have both stopped out and suffered losses. Specifically, address 0x955...396A8 opened a long position this morning when BTC rebounded, then panic-closed it during the rapid pullback at midday, losing approximately $217,000 in just 4 hours. Address 0x960...0e2Ee went long on BTC and ETH on October 27th when the price reached a high of $115,372.8, with a total position reaching $36.87 million at one point, but ultimately liquidated it during the decline, losing approximately $1.061 million in 24 hours.

data.title: Indonesia Plans to Issue Tokenized Government Bonds Backed by CBDC
data.description: According to BlockBeats, the Governor of Indonesia's central bank has announced plans to issue digital central bank securities, which will be a tokenized version of government bonds. These securities will be built on the country's central bank digital currency (CBDC), known as the digital rupiah. The digital issuance of these securities aims to create a stablecoin backed by government bonds, representing Indonesia's national version of a stablecoin.
